macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indices Show Mixed YTD Gains with Small Caps Leading
items.summary: Russell 2000 up 5.7% YTD, Dow Jones +3.0%, NASDAQ 100 +1.8%, and S&P 500 +1.8% as of early January 2026, reflecting rotation from tech to cyclicals and small caps. S&P 500 closed flat at 6977 points recently amid ongoing market consolidation.

items.title: US CPI Data and Bank Earnings Kick Off Major Market Movers Today
items.summary: December US CPI release expected to drive volatility in dollar, bonds, and equities, with focus on core inflation and services prices. Earnings season starts with JPMorgan and Delta reports setting tone for financials and transport sectors.

items.title: USD Weakens on Fed Independence Concerns Amid DOJ Probe into Powell
items.summary: USD slipped 0.3% due to worries over Federal Reserve independence following US Department of Justice criminal investigation into Chair Powell. Former Chair Yellen called the probe 'extremely chilling,' potentially impacting Fed rate trajectory.

items.title: Gold Rally Continues on Geopolitical Tensions and Fed Worries
items.summary: Gold gained nearly 2% amid safe-haven demand from US tariff threats on Iran business, Venezuela intervention, Greenland takeover talk, and Fed probe. Prices approach resistance at $4,727/oz despite stretched positioning.

items.title: Major US Bank Earnings Week Looms with Dow Bullish Trend Intact
items.summary: JPMorgan reports Tuesday, followed by Bank of America, Citigroup, Wells Fargo Wednesday, and Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs Thursday. Capital rotation favors Dow (+3% YTD) and Russell 2000 ahead of results.

items.title: US Stocks Mixed Last Week on Labor Data and Bank Pullback
items.summary: S&P 500 eased 0.2%, Dow slid 0.8%, Nasdaq 100 gained 0.1% as JOLTS showed cooling job openings, ADP hiring rebounded modestly, and ISM Services beat expectations. Banks like JPMorgan and Bank of America fell over 2%.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Bearish Correction Ahead of US CPI Data
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading at $92,168 and expected to test support near $88,505 before potential recovery. The US December CPI report releasing today could significantly impact Fed rate expectations and crypto market sentiment.

items.title: Monero Reaches All-Time High Amid Privacy Coin Demand
items.summary: Monero (XMR) surged 13.35% in 24 hours to $567.29, reaching a new all-time high as investors show renewed interest in privacy-focused cryptocurrencies amid market volatility.

items.title: JPMorgan Launches JPM Coin on Canton Network
items.summary: JPMorgan announced it will issue its USD-backed stablecoin JPM Coin on the Canton Network, a privacy-focused blockchain, expanding its multi-blockchain stablecoin strategy.

items.title: Crypto Market Enters Consolidation Mode
items.summary: Digital assets moved into consolidation with the Top10 Crypto CTI declining 0.7% weekly. The AI CTI advanced 7% while the Meme CTI corrected 8% after the previous week's gains.

items.title: Zcash Falls 14% After Key Developer Team Departure
items.summary: Privacy token Zcash dropped 14% following the departure of a key developer team over governance disagreements, raising concerns about the project's direction.

items.title: Major Upcoming Crypto Events This Week
items.summary: Key events include BNB Chain's Fermi hard fork (Jan 14), Ravencoin's block reward halving (Jan 15), and Arbitrum's token unlock of 92.65 million tokens (Jan 16). Ondo's massive 1.94 billion token unlock is scheduled for Jan 18.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Freenome Expands AI and Deep Learning Initiatives with NVIDIA for Multi-Cancer Detection
items.summary: Freenome announced expanded AI and deep learning projects accelerated by NVIDIA, including a Fragment-level Deep Learning (FLDL) model to improve speed and accuracy in analyzing large cfDNA datasets from blood tests for personalized cancer screening.

items.title: Penn State Develops ZENN AI Framework to Handle Variable Data Quality in Research
items.summary: Researchers at Penn State introduced ZENN (Zentropy-Embedded Neural Networks), a new AI approach that adapts to differences in data quality from various instruments, enhancing accuracy in fields like Alzheimer's research and materials design.

items.title: Meta Launches 'Meta Compute' AI Infrastructure Initiative for Massive Data Center Expansion
items.summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced 'Meta Compute,' a decade-long plan to build tens of gigawatts of AI infrastructure, led by Santosh Janardhan and Daniel Gross, backed by billions in investments for superintelligence pursuits.

items.title: CES 2026 Highlights AI Shift from Hardware to Product Deployment and Global Scaling
items.summary: At CES 2026, industry leaders discussed moving beyond AI hardware to focus on operations, software, monetization, and global adoption of AI-native products, as emphasized by Subotiz CEO Jeff Li.

items.title: China Aims to Mitigate AI Job Impacts While Building Talent Pipeline
items.summary: China's AI core industry nears 600 billion yuan scale, with surging talent demand amid breakthroughs in large language models and AI integration into manufacturing, services, and biotech.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Magic Forge Tycoon Launches Today in Early 2026 Release Wave
items.summary: Magic Forge Tycoon, a strategy and management sim focused on building a magical crafting business, releases on January 13, 2026, kicking off a week of indie and mid-tier games including JRPG The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon and horror title BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW.

items.title: Star Wars Outlaws Joins Xbox Game Pass on January 13
items.summary: Star Wars Outlaws arrives on Xbox Game Pass for Series X|S, PC, and Cloud on January 13, 2026, alongside other upcoming titles like My Little Pony: A Zephyr Heights Mystery on January 15.

items.title: Hytale Enters Early Access on PC Today After Securing Funding
items.summary: Long-awaited Minecraft-inspired game Hytale launches in early access on PC on January 13, 2026, following news that developer Hypixel Studios has secured funding for the next two years of development.

items.title: The Sims 4 Receives Free Coach Collection Update January 13
items.summary: The Coach Collection, featuring nine new Create a Sim items, Build Buy decor, and a new Gallery household, drops for free in The Sims 4 base game on January 13, 2026.

items.title: Nintendo News Roundup: Animal Crossing Updates and Switch Changes
items.summary: Recent Nintendo updates include Animal Crossing: New Horizons 3.0 on January 15, Tetris 99 crossover, Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance on Switch 2 Classics, and discontinuation of Switch Game Vouchers by January 31, 2026.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Canon Achieves World First in Inkjet-Based Wafer Planarization
items.summary: Canon Inc. announced a breakthrough technology using inkjet methods to create dramatically smoother wafer surfaces, marking a world first in semiconductor manufacturing processes.

items.title: Alphabet Reaches $4 Trillion Valuation Milestone
items.summary: Google parent Alphabet Inc. became the fourth Big Tech company valued at $4 trillion, highlighting the sector's rapid growth amid market milestones.

items.title: Meta Appoints Dina Powell McCormick as President and Vice Chairman
items.summary: Meta named former Trump adviser Dina Powell McCormick to the roles of president and vice chairman, signaling a high-profile leadership addition.

items.title: Trump Demands Tech Giants Pay Full Cost of Data Center Electricity
items.summary: President Trump stated that tech companies building data centers must cover their own electricity costs, amid rising power prices and infrastructure debates.

items.title: Tech Investors Eye Gains from Potential U.S. Takeover of Greenland
items.summary: Discussions of a U.S. acquisition of Greenland under Trump are sparking investor interest in its rare earth minerals vital for smartphones, EVs, semiconductors, and defense tech.
